references.paper_title: Performance-optimized hierarchical models predict neural responses in higher visual cortex
references.reason: This paper is foundational for using deep neural networks to model primate visual system responses.

references.paper_title: Integrative benchmarking to advance neurally mechanistic models of human intelligence
references.reason: This paper introduces a comprehensive framework for evaluating neural models of intelligence, which is highly relevant to the current work.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised neural network models of the ventral visual stream
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the success of self-supervised learning in modeling the primate ventral stream, providing a strong baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: Barlow twins: Self-supervised learning via redundancy reduction
references.reason: This paper introduces the Barlow Twins self-supervised learning method, which is directly relevant to the proposed contrastive-equivariant approach.
This paper provides a crucial overview of the challenges and progress in achieving invariant object recognition, highlighting the importance of understanding invariance and equivariance.
